page.title: 13THE MILKMAN
page.content: Mr Butt started in his fathers milk delivery business in 1934.They delivered milk to the village in those days on a bicycle and sidecar.The round would take about 4 hours. Eventually they had a pony and float and later still a van. They had 15 cows which they milked by hand .It was a 7 day week for the milkmen even delivering on Christmas Day. Milk cost 2 1/2d in winter and 2d in summer. Now it is 23p per pint winter or summer. Our milk comes in one pint glass bottles.Mr Butt used a 10 gallon churn and measured out as much milk as you wanted with a hand can. The customer supplied their own containers. Bottles were used at the end of the war.The Butt family gave up their milk business in 1949.
